summary_points: 1. Royal Caribbean Cruises Ltd. completed the exchange of approximately $213 million in 6.000% Convertible Senior Notes due 2025 for approximately 3.3 million shares of common stock and $214 million in cash on March 19, 2025.
2.  The Exchange Transactions reduced Royal Caribbean's fully diluted shares outstanding by 1.0 million shares, leaving approximately $110 million in principal amount of the 2025 Notes outstanding.
3. The shares issued were not registered under the Securities Act of 1933, relying on the Section 4(a)(2) exemption for a private placement to accredited investors and qualified institutional buyers.

1. On March 18, 2025, Celanese Corporation announced early results and an upsize of cash tender offers to purchase up to €552,082,000 of its 4.777% Senior Notes due 2026 and up to $500,000,000 of its 6.415% Senior Notes due 2027.

2.  As of the early tender time on March 18, 2025, €552,082,000 of the 2026 notes and $1,354,646,000 of the 2027 notes were validly tendered, resulting in a 36.40% pro-rata acceptance for the 2027 notes.
3. Celanese expects to pay for the accepted notes on March 21, 2025.
1. Quest Diagnostics projects a 7-9% adjusted EPS CAGR after 2025, based on projections made during their March 19, 2025 Investor Day.
2.  $250-$310 million will be invested in Project Nova.
3. In 2024, Quest Diagnostics generated approximately $900 million in revenue from advanced diagnostic tests.
1. General Mills' Q3 2025 net sales decreased 5% year-over-year to $4.84 billion,  primarily due to lower volume and unfavorable currency exchange.
2.  General Mills acquired Whitebridge Pet Brands for $1.4 billion in Q3 2025.
3. The sale of General Mills' North American yogurt business is expected to close in 2025, pending regulatory approvals;  conflicting information exists regarding the pre-tax impact of this sale.
1. Best Buy's fiscal year 2025 revenue decreased by $200 million to $1.1 billion compared to $1.3 billion in fiscal year 2024.
2. Best Buy recorded a $475 million non-cash goodwill impairment charge related to its Best Buy Health unit in fiscal 2025.
3. Best Buy plans to close 5-10 Domestic segment stores in fiscal 2026.
1. Extra Space Storage LP completed a $500,000,000 public offering of 5.400% Senior Notes due 2035, fully guaranteed by Extra Space Storage Inc. and two business trusts.
2.  As of March 19, 2025, the company had issued over $5 billion in senior notes across various maturities.

3.  The Notes contain covenants limiting the Issuer's ability to incur additional debt, exceeding 60% of Total Assets or 40% secured debt, and requiring maintenance of unencumbered assets at 150% of outstanding unsecured debt.
1. On March 17, 2025, Entergy Corporation entered into forward sale agreements and an underwriting agreement for a total of 15,568,863 shares of its common stock.
2.  On March 19, 2025, 15,568,863 shares of common stock were sold to underwriters, resulting in immediate dilution to Entergy's earnings per share.

3.  The forward sale agreements allow for settlement (physical, net share, or cash) at Entergy's discretion until September 30, 2026; however, the agreements contain acceleration clauses that could force Entergy into physical settlement earlier under certain circumstances.
1. Quest Diagnostics reaffirmed its full-year 2025 guidance, but anticipates a $25 million revenue and $0.10 EPS headwind due to unforeseen adverse weather in Q1 2025.
2.  The company projects long-term (beyond 2025) revenue growth at a 4-5% compound annual growth rate (CAGR) and adjusted diluted earnings per share (EPS) growth at a 7-9% CAGR.

3.  The company's long-term outlook is based on several strategic initiatives, including investments in automation, robotics, AI, and a new IT initiative (Project Nova) aimed at modernizing systems architecture and lowering IT costs.
1. Progressive Corp's net premiums written increased by 17% in February 2025 compared to February 2024, reaching $6,684 million.
2.  The company's net income for February 2025 was $928 million, a 26% increase year-over-year.
3. Progressive plans to release March 2025 results on April 16, 2025.
1. On March 19, 2025, Cigna completed the sale of its Medicare Advantage, supplemental benefits, Part D, and CareAllies businesses to Health Care Service Corporation (HCSC).
2. The majority of the proceeds from the sale are expected to be used for share repurchases.

3. Cigna will continue providing pharmacy benefit services and other solutions to the divested businesses through Evernorth Health Services under service agreements with HCSC for a specified period after the closing.
1. Verizon increased the annual target long-term incentive opportunity for its CEO, Hans Vestberg, from $18,000,000 to $25,000,000, effective March 18, 2025.
2.  In the first quarter of 2025, Verizon reclassified recurring device protection revenues and changed how it calculates certain wireless metrics, impacting historical financial data.
3. Verizon's Exhibit 99.1 provides recast unaudited historical financial and operating information reflecting the reclassification of revenues and changes in metric calculation, as of March 31, 2024.

1. General Mills' fiscal Q3 2025 net sales were down 5% to $4.8 billion, with organic net sales also down 5%, primarily due to retailer inventory reductions and the reversal of favorable second-quarter timing items.
2.  Adjusted diluted earnings per share (EPS) for fiscal Q3 2025 was down 15% in constant currency to $1.00.

3. General Mills projects fiscal year 2025 organic net sales to be down 1.5% to 2%, and adjusted operating profit and adjusted diluted EPS to be down 7% to 8% in constant currency;  they anticipate at least $700 million in cost savings in fiscal year 2026 from productivity programs and cost-efficiency initiatives.
1. News Corp repurchased approximately US$649,909,484.09 worth of Class A and Class B shares as of March 18, 2025, under its US$1 billion stock repurchase program.

2. On March 18, 2025, 21,269,372 Class A shares and 10,495,112 Class B shares were repurchased at a highest price of US$30.69 and US$35.25 respectively, and a lowest price of US$14.88 and US$15.17 respectively (all prices in USD).
3.  News Corp intends to continue repurchasing its Class A and Class B common stock, subject to market conditions and other factors, with no ASX-listed CDIs to be repurchased.

1. Omnicom Group Inc. stockholders approved the issuance of common stock to Interpublic Group of Companies, Inc. stockholders in connection with a merger, with 155,510,386 votes for and 10,776,253 votes against.
2. The merger between Omnicom and Interpublic is expected to complete in the second half of 2025, contingent on governmental and regulatory approvals and the satisfaction of other closing conditions.
3.  Potential risks to the merger include the failure to obtain necessary governmental approvals, delays in completing the merger, and the possibility of the merger being terminated.
1. On March 18, 2025, Interpublic Group of Companies, Inc. stockholders approved the acquisition by Omnicom Group Inc., with approximately 87.75% of outstanding shares voting in favor.
2.  While 325,789,406 shares voted for the merger,  1,070,178 voted against it, and 155,349 abstained.
3. The SEC filing highlights several risks to the merger's completion, including regulatory approvals and potential delays.
1. Republic Services, Inc. agreed to sell $500,000,000 of 4.750% notes due 2030 and $700,000,000 of 5.150% notes due 2035 on March 17, 2025, with the offering expected to close around March 24, 2025.
2. The sale of the notes will raise $1,200,000,000 in aggregate principal amount.
3.  The underwriting agreement includes indemnification and contribution provisions that could expose Republic Services to significant future financial liabilities.
